{"step_by_step_thinking": "Atypical root canal or root refers to the unusual or non-standard formation of the root canal system in a tooth. The mandibular first premolar is known to have the highest incidence of atypical root canal morphology among all teeth. It often has more than one root, which is not the standard for premolars, and the root canal system can be complex.", "answer_choice": "A. Mandibular 1st premolar"}
